channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: At least 18 migrants die after boat sinks near Greek island of Crete
item.description: The migrants were attempting to cross the Mediterranean Sea in an inflatable boat when it capsized south of the island of Crete, Greek authorities said Saturday. At least two people have been rescued.
item.content:encoded: The migrants were attempting to cross the Mediterranean Sea in an inflatable boat when it capsized south of the island of Crete, Greek authorities said Saturday. At least two people have been rescued.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A year on, protesters in Tbilisi, Georgia refuse to accept pivot to Russia
item.description: Protesters in Tbilisi, Georgia mark a year of unrest, accusing the government of ditching Europe for closer ties with Russia.
item.content:encoded: Protesters in Tbilisi, Georgia mark a year of unrest, accusing the government of ditching Europe for closer ties with Russia.
item.dc:creator: Robin Forestier-Walker

item.title: Putin finds a warm welcome in India
item.description: Professor Šumit Ganguly, Director of the Huntington Program at Stanford's Hoover Institution, says Putin's visit to India reflects ongoing ties despite U.S. pressure.
item.content:encoded: Professor Šumit Ganguly, Director of the Huntington Program at Stanford's Hoover Institution, says Putin's visit to India reflects ongoing ties despite U.S. pressure.
item.dc:creator: Ahmad Damen

item.title: Gaza students killed while waiting for visas to study abroad
item.description: Gaza students with scholarships to Canada say visa delays have left many stranded, and some were killed waiting to leave.
item.content:encoded: Gaza students with scholarships to Canada say visa delays have left many stranded, and some were killed waiting to leave.
item.dc:creator: Abu Bakr Bashir

item.title: This metalworker is creating suits of armor for mice
item.description: Calgary artist Jeff De Boer has spent decades learning, perfecting, and teaching the art of making suits of armor. For mice.
item.content:encoded: Calgary artist Jeff De Boer has spent decades learning, perfecting, and teaching the art of making suits of armor. For mice.
item.dc:creator: Deena Prichep

item.title: The aftermath of the assassination of Carlos Manzo, a former mayor in Mexico
item.description: Carlos Manzo was the mayor of a city in Michoacan, Mexico. He launched a full-frontal assault on organized crime. Last month he was assassinated by a lone gunman, sparking protests across the country.
item.content:encoded: Carlos Manzo was the mayor of a city in Michoacan, Mexico. He launched a full-frontal assault on organized crime. Last month he was assassinated by a lone gunman, sparking protests across the country.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: A look at Australia's upcoming social media ban for children under age 16
item.description: NPR's Eyder Peralta speaks with Susan Sawyer of the University of Melbourne about Australia's new ban on social media for children under 16. It goes into effect next week.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Eyder Peralta speaks with Susan Sawyer of the University of Melbourne about Australia's new ban on social media for children under 16. It goes into effect next week.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Sudanese paramilitary drone attack kills 50, including 33 children, doctor group says
item.description: Thursday's attack is the latest in the fighting between the paramilitary group, the Rapid Support Forces, also known as the RSF, and the Sudanese military, who have been at war for over two years.
item.content:encoded:
Thursday's attack is the latest in the fighting between the paramilitary group, the Rapid Support Forces, also known as the RSF, and the Sudanese military, who have been at war for over two years.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Russia unleashes drone and missile attack on Ukraine as diplomatic talks continue
item.description: Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, after U.S. and Ukrainian officials said they'll meet on Saturday for talks aimed at ending the war.
item.content:encoded:
Russia unleashed a major missile and drone barrage on Ukraine overnight into Saturday, after U.S. and Ukrainian officials said they'll meet on Saturday for talks aimed at ending the war.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump's 'garbage' comment met with disappointment in Somalia
item.description: In Somalia, people are pushing back and pointing to the positives after President Trump disparaged their country.
item.content:encoded:
In Somalia, people are pushing back and pointing to the positives after President Trump disparaged their country.

(Image credit: Tony Karumba)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett
